game

Class Truck

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Truck
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BoardElement, Colorable, UserData, java.lang.Runnable, org.json.JSONString

    public class Truck
extends java.lang.Object
implements BoardElement, java.lang.Runnable
    CLass Truck is a runnable object that represents a single Truck in the game. Trucks are instantiated by the game and put into their own thread to run. Trucks maintain a queue of travel directions, each of which is an edge to travel. While the queue is empty, trucks idle at their current location. Once the queue is populated, the truck will continue to follow those directions until the queue is empty again. The speed at which a Truck travels can be set using method setSpeed(int i), which determines how many units of road the truck travels each frame. Trucks can be told to pick up or drop off parcels when they are not traveling.

    Interaction with Trucks is done through the Truck's internal calling of method truckNotification in class Manager. Whenever the Truck makes an action or reaches a point of decision, it lets the manager know of this change, allowing for input at that time.
    Author:
    MPatashnik

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Truck.Status
      The Two states that a Truck can be in at any time - either Waiting (staying on its location and awaiting further travel instructions) or Traveling (currently moving from node to node according to its travel instructions).

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The Truck's main running routine. While the travel directions are empty, Waits for more instructions in WAIT_TIME intervals. While the travel directions are not empty, pops off the next travel direction.

        Called and on loop until the game ends. Terminates itself when there are no more parcels and this truck is at the Truck Depot. Once that occurs, doesn't take any more instructions. Students: don't call this procedure!
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getManager

        public Manager getManager()
        Return the manager that is managing this truck.

        Return the name of this Truck.

      • setTruckName

        public void setTruckName(java.lang.String newName)
        Set the name of this Truck to newName and, if it is not yet assigned to this thread, set it to this thread.

      • isAlive

        public boolean isAlive()
        Return true iff this Truck is alive (executing its run loop).

      • getLocation

        public Node getLocation()
        Return the Truck's current location. (Return null if this.status.equals(Status.TRAVELING) or the calling thread is interrupted.)

      • getTravelingTo

        public Node getTravelingTo()
        Return the Truck's current destination. (Return null if this.status.equals(Status.WAITING) or if the calling thread is interrupted).

      • getTravelingAlong

        public Edge getTravelingAlong()
        Return the edge this Truck is traveling along. (Return null if status.equals(Status.WAITING) or if the calling thread is interrupted.)

      • getComingFrom

        public Node getComingFrom()
        Return the node this truck is coming from, the rear exit of the edge it is currently on. (Return null if status.equals(Status.WAITING) or if the calling thread is interrupted.)

      • getGoingTo

        public Node getGoingTo()
        Return the Truck's eventual destination; the Node this Truck will be at when the current travel queue is empty. (Return null if this.status.equals(Status.WAITING) or if the calling thread is interrupted.)

      • getStatus

        public Truck.Status getStatus()
        Return the current status of this Truck, either TRAVELING or WAITING. Return null if the thread is interrupted.

      • isWaitingForManager

        public boolean isWaitingForManager()
        Return true iff this truck is waiting for manager input. Useful for debugging purposes. If manager is recursing forever, trucks wait forever.

      • getLoad

        public Parcel getLoad()
        Return the parcel this Truck is carrying. (null if none). Return null if the calling thread is interrupted

      • getColor

        public java.awt.Color getColor()
        Return the Color of this Truck. Because the color of a truck has game significance, this will not be changed while the game is running.
        Specified by:
        getColor in interface Colorable

        public boolean isColorSignificant()
        Return true - the color of Trucks is significant
        Specified by:

      • getSpeed

        public int getSpeed()
        Return the speed this truck will/is traveling. Return -1 if the calling thread is interrupted

      • setSpeed

        public void setSpeed(int newSpeed)
        Set this trucks speed. Does not change the speed if the calling thread is interrupted

        Specified by:

      • pickupLoad

        public void pickupLoad(Parcel p)
                throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Pick up parcel p at the current location. If there is, add it to Truck and wait PARCEL_PICKUP_TIME seconds. Do nothing (does not pick up) if the calling thread is interrupted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - - if load is not null (can't pick up) or if this Truck is currently traveling.

      • dropoffLoad

        public void dropoffLoad()
                 throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Drop off load at the current location. Throw a RuntimeException if load is null Do nothing (don't drop off) if the calling thread is interrupted.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException

      • getCircle

        public Circle getCircle()
        Return the circle that represents this truck when it is drawn

      • addToTravel

        public void addToTravel(Edge r)
        Add road r to this Truck's travel plans, in a fashion that prevents thread collision. Do nothing if the thread is interrupted.

      • setTravelQueue

        public void setTravelQueue(java.util.List<Edge> path)
        Clear the Travel queue, then Set the travel queue to travel the given list of edges, in order.

      • setTravelPath

        public void setTravelPath(java.util.List<Node> path)
                   throws java.lang.RuntimeException
        Clear the travel queue, then Set the travel queue to travel the given path. First element is the truck's current location, and the last is the expected destination.
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - if the truck isn't currently at the first node in the path.

      • clearTravel

        public void clearTravel()
        Clear the Truck's travel plans, in a fashion that prevents thread collision. Reset goingTo (the Node the Truck will eventually end up at) to the value of the travelingTo field (the Node the Truck is currently traveling toward). Do nothing (don't clear) if the calling thread is interrupted.

      • updateGUILocation

        public void updateGUILocation(int x,
                     int y)
        Update the circle graphic that represents this truck on the GUI. Do nothing if threads is null. Also update the location of the load, if this truck is carrying one.
        Specified by:
        updateGUILocation in interface BoardElement
        Parameters:
        x - - the new X location of this Truck in the GUI
        y - - the new Y location of this Truck in the GUI
